meanings.definition: A chemical species that donates an electron pair to an electrophile to form a chemical bond.
meanings.sent1: The nucleophile shared its electrons with the electrophile.
meanings.sent2: The nucleophile bonded with the electrophile to create a new compound.
meanings.sent3: The nucleophile was feeling generous and decided to give its electrons away for free.
meanings.sent4: Like a friendly neighbor, the nucleophile reached out to the electrophile with an electron handshake.
meanings.sent5: The nucleophile acted like a matchmaker, bringing the electrophile and electrons together in harmony.

meanings.definition: A nucleophile is attracted to positively charged atoms or groups.
meanings.sent1: The nucleophile was drawn to the positively charged atom like a magnet.
meanings.sent2: Positively charged atoms always catch the attention of a nucleophile.
meanings.sent3: The nucleophile couldn't resist the allure of the positively charged group.
meanings.sent4: The positively charged atom was like a beacon calling out to the nucleophile.
meanings.sent5: The nucleophile eagerly gravitated towards the positively charged atoms, eager to bond.
